revised_title: The Skeleton and Classification of Calcareous Sponges: A Crystallographic Approach
tldr: The author examines the structure and classification of calcareous sponges, focusing on the role of spicules as skeleton crystals of calcite. They propose a crystallographic interpretation of spicule formation and deformation, suggesting that the triradiate spicule is a skeleton of a hexagonal prism region enclosed by two surfaces that limit the formation of material. This study provides a deeper understanding of sponge biology and the role of spicules in their structure.
